channel.title: interest rates on FinanClub
channel.description: Recent content in interest rates on FinanClub

item.title: Banxico to Keep Interest Rates High for Long Period of Time
item.description: Banxico to Keep Interest Rates High for Long Period of Time Mexico’s central bank, Banxico, has signaled that it will keep interest rates high for a long period of time in order to tame inflation. The bank’s decision comes as inflation in Mexico has reached a 20-year high.

item.title: ECB Says Core Price Trend Was 'Broadly Seen as Worrisome' in May
item.description: ECB Concerned About Inflation The European Central Bank (ECB) is concerned about the path of inflation, according to the minutes of its May policy meeting. Core inflation, which excludes food and energy, rose to 3.8% in May from 3.5% in April. This was the highest level since December 2012.

item.title: Five Things You Need to Know to Start Your Day
item.description: Five Things to Know to Start Your Day The Federal Reserve is expected to raise interest rates by 0.50% today. The stock market is expected to open lower today. Oil prices are rising today. The yield on the 10-year Treasury note is rising today.

item.title: ECB's Lagarde Sees No Clear Evidence Core Inflation Has Peaked
item.description: ECB’s Lagarde Sees No Clear Evidence Core Inflation Has Peaked European Central Bank (ECB) President Christine Lagarde said on Thursday that there is no clear evidence that underlying inflation has peaked. Core inflation, which excludes food and energy prices, rose to 3.

item.title: UK Mortgage Lending Unexpectedly Falls After Interest Rate Hikes
item.description: UK Mortgage Lending Falls Unexpectedly After Interest Rate Hikes Mortgage lending in the UK fell unexpectedly in April, after the Bank of England raised interest rates for the fifth time in a row. Lenders authorized 48,700 home loans in April, down sharply from the 51,500 approved in March.
